Courage

"Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts." -Winston Churchill

I really like this quote. What I especially like about it is the implication that failure is not a bad thing. You will fail again and again. But, It’s the courage to pick your ass up and try again that’s most important. I’ll continue to work diligently at my job. I’ll continue to be wrong; to fail. I will, however, iterate towards improvement.

 

BOMTYCC

BOMTYCC (Bite Off More Than You Can Chew)

BOMTYCC. Powerful advice from Tom Preston-Werner, co-founder of GitHub.

I recently watched the video of Tom’s presentation from RubyConf 2010 entitled: “The Road from Ruby Hacker to Entrepreneur”.

Tom outlines his journey from anonymous Ruby hacker to successful entrepreneur. A recurring theme to his journey was his willingness to BOMTYCC.

Perhaps without realizing it, I’ve been practicing BOMTYCC too.

BOMTYCC it …

- is an ethic.
- is a positive force behind learning.
- enables you to follow that little urge which says “why not?”
- makes building stuff fun.

On this last day of 2010, I hope to have more BOMTYCC in the coming year. Perhaps, one more step in my own journey from biologist seduced by computers to a successful craftsman and maybe even entrepreneur.

 

Well, Hello World.

The obligatory “Hello World” post.

Blogging like a hacker using Jekyll to generate static pages. Deployed under Sinatra and hosted on Heroku .

I have no idea how this will unfold, but that’s the fun part.

Let’s test out the code highlighting feature.

def HelloWorld
  puts 'Well, Hello World!'
end
